page.title: 20KING'S PARK CEMETERY
page.content: In King's Park cemetery at one end are the Jewish people and at the other Christians. There is a big square in the centre with a hedge around it and sixty-four grave stones inside, but because these are soldiers who died in the First and Second World Wars there might not be any bodies. There are nine people to look after the grave-stones. The cemetery and church were built in 1896, two years before the first person, Jean Jacques, was buried there. His grave-stone is an ivory cross with Jesus on. The person who was buried there most recently was Elsie Erwin who was buried on Tuesday, 25 June 1985. All around are crosses, arches, hearts and angels which cost a lot of money. After about ninety to a hundred years they are dug up and someone else is buried there. Janine Ross 1N1.
